description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in an interview with Panama City radio station WFLA 94.5:
quote_txt: "Our credit rating went up since I've been in office."

description_txt: stated on August 16, 2011 in an interview.:
quote_txt: Says Rick Perry "wanted to secede from the union."

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in the GOP debate in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: Says that he did "not exactly" say that communities have the right to ban mosques.

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2011 in a speech to a Manchester, N.H. Rotary club:
quote_txt: Says he worked with the Democratic legislature to balance spending with revenues so that "at the end of my four-year term, the rainy day fund was established at more than $2 billion."

description_txt: stated on August 15, 2011 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Says the government wants to require farm tractor drivers to hold commercial driver’s licenses even if they’re just crossing a single public road.

description_txt: stated on July 26, 2011 in an interview with Politico:
quote_txt: "Josh Mandel used to be pro-choice, now he’s anti-choice. He used to be sympathetic towards gay and lesbians and now he’s [not]."

description_txt: stated on August 4, 2011 in a talk at the Atlanta Press Club:
quote_txt: "The governor having a meeting ... isn't covered by the open meetings act."

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in an interview with ABC TV.:
quote_txt: "Twenty-five states have lower unemployment than Texas" which is "tied with Mississippi for more minimum-wage jobs than anywhere in the United States."

description_txt: stated on August 15, 2011 in a column in the "New York Times":
quote_txt: "One in four Texans lacks health insurance, the highest proportion in the nation."

description_txt: stated on August 10, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Credit agency says Rep. Gibbs recklessly caused downgrade, higher interest rates."

description_txt: stated on August 1, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: Tax increases could "come into play" as a result of the debt ceiling deal.

description_txt: stated on August 9, 2011 in a petition:
quote_txt: Says the state’s pension and health benefits reform includes "the destruction of public sector collective bargaining rights."

description_txt: stated on August 10, 2011 in an article on his website:
quote_txt: Says "of the 2,000 Portland households in the year-long (composting) pilot, 87 percent of participants reported being satisfied with the overall system."

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in an interview with the 'Miami Herald.':
quote_txt: "The weight of the evidence (on global warming) is that most of it, maybe all of it, is because of natural causes ... it’s fair to say the science is in dispute."

description_txt: stated on July 24, 2011 in a Providence Journal commentary:
quote_txt: Statistically, law-enforcement officers die 10 years earlier than the general population.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • August 14, 2011

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2011 in a New Hampshire town hall.:
quote_txt: Says a poll found him the only Republican candidate who could beat Barack Obama in Texas -- and by eight points.

description_txt: stated on July 27, 2011 in in a NJToday interview:
quote_txt: "Certainly we're going to be the most restrictive state in the land … in terms of who can get medical marijuana, how it will be prescribed and how it will be achieved in terms of moving it into the marketplace."

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in a debate in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: When Standard & Poor's "dropped our credit rating, what they said is, we don't have an ability to repay our debt. ... I was proved right in my position" that the debt ceiling should not have been raised.

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in the Republican debate in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: Says that under President John F. Kennedy, "government took up" 27 percent of the economy, and today it "consumes 37 percent."

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: "President Obama and Democrats' spending addiction has driven our national debt to historic proportions, maxed out our national credit card and has now led to the Democrat Downgrade of our country's AAA credit rating."

description_txt: stated on August 4, 2011 in campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Says Republican recall challenger Jonathan Steitz "failed to pay his taxes."

description_txt: stated on July 21, 2011 in a letter and news release:
quote_txt: Says Democratic state Sen. Jim Holperin "voted against a property tax freeze" in 2009 and then voted for a "$1.5 billion property tax hike."

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in in a debate in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: "The country's bankrupt."

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in the Republican debate in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: "We created a flat tax in the state of Utah."

description_txt: stated on August 3, 2011 in a newspaper column.:
quote_txt: Virginia has a responsibility to fund 55 percent of public education and is paying just 41 percent.

description_txt: stated on August 3, 2011 in comments made to reporters while in Tampa:
quote_txt: The Republican National Convention "is a Super Bowl times four."

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in the Republican debate in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: "We're inches away from no longer having a free economy."

description_txt: stated on August 11, 2011 in a debate in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: "Obamacare was patterned after (Mitt Romney's) plan in Massachusetts."

description_txt: stated on July 25, 2011 in campaign mail piece:
quote_txt: Says he "helped bring" Uline company to Kenosha area, "creating 800 local jobs."

description_txt: stated on August 5, 2011 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Says GOP recall challenger Kim Simac "was delinquent paying her property taxes eight of the last nine years."
